Class ApplySpec¶

  • Defined in File ApplySpec.h

Class Documentation¶

class ApplySpec¶

Public Functions

ApplySpec()¶

Default constructor for ApplySpec class.

void setArgs(string database, bool is_spatial, string sample_file, string time_config, string is_fragments, vector<double> speciation_rates)¶

Sets the application arguments for the inputs. Intended for use with the applyspecmodule for integration with python.

Parameters
  • database: the database to apply speciation rates to
  • is_spatial: if true, record full spatial data
  • sample_file: the sample file to select lineages from the map
  • time_config: the time config file to use
  • is_fragments: fragment file, or “T”/”F” for automatic detection/no detection
  • speciation_rates: the speciation rates to apply

void parseArgs()¶

Run the command line arguments check. Writes arguments to the SpecSimParameters object.

Parameters
  • argc: the number of arguments.
  • comargs: a vector filled with the command line arguments

void writeSpeciationRates()¶

Prints speciation rates to terminal.

void importTimeConfig()¶

Import the time config file, if there is one.

void importData()¶

Imports the data from the file.

bool checkUniqueSpec(unsigned int i)¶

Checks for unique speciation rates.

Return
true if speciation rate is unique, false otherwises
Parameters
  • i: the index of the speciation rate to check for in sp.vSpecRates

void applyMultiTimes(int i)¶

Apply multiple times to the Tree for a particular speciation rate.

Parameters
  • i: the reference in dUniqueSpec to apply

void applySingleTime(int i)¶

Apply a single time (generation 0.0) and speciation rate to the Tree.

Parameters
  • i: the

void calculateTree()¶
int applyFromComargs(int argc_in, char **argv)¶

Runs the main program including parsing command line arguments and running the main analyses.

Return
Parameters
  • argc: the number of command line arguments
  • argv: the array of command line arguments

void apply()¶

Applies the imported speciation rates to the coalescence tree. This is the main function that contains all inner routines.
